allOf.title: ModuleConfiguration
allOf.description:
Defines a "DevEx Module" that is a Helix-like module that can contain serialized item configurations, etc.
This class is overridden with Serialization-specific derived versions that provide access to their module-specific settings.

namespace.description:
The namespace of the module. All resources in the module inherit this namespace.
Namespaces can contain letters, numbers, dots (.), and hyphens (-).

description.description: Description of the module, for reference/docs purposes only

references.description: Names of other modules that are referenced by resources in this module. Wildcards are allowed, i.e. Foundation.*.

source.description: Generic identifier as to where the module came from. Used internally for error messaging. Do not set in a module file; it will be ignored.

items.description: Configures content item serialization in this module

path.description:
The relative physical path to store serialized item files at. Serialized items will be stored at this path using sub-directories named the same as the name attribute on their include.
Prefix the path with ~/ for a root configuration relative path instead of a module-relative path. Use '$(module)' to insert the module name when using a root relative path.
Set DefaultModuleRelativeSerializationPath on the root configuration to configure the default.

includes.description: Configure item paths to serialize in this module

path.description: The Sitecore item path that forms the root of this include.

scope.description: The scope of items to be serialized (how deep to traverse the tree)

allowedPushOperations.description: When pushing into Sitecore, what is allowed to happen when we detect changes?

rules.description: Additional rules to apply to children of the root path, i.e. exclusions, path aliases. Rules are executed in order; execution stops after the first matching rule is executed. Place the MOST SPECIFIC rules first.

maxRelativePathLength.description: Max item path length relative to the root before requiring use of path aliases to shorten paths. In most cases, this should be set globally in sitecore.json.

name.description: Name of the subtree. Must be unique within the module. Serialized items will be stored in a folder by this name. Favor terse names.

database.description: The Sitecore database that this path is sourced from. Unless you really know what you're doing, do not change this.

TreeScope.description:
The allowed scopes for a serialized tree root.
Note that tree rules can modify what is included under a root,
but prefetched data ignores rules.

AllowedPushOperations.description: The allowed operations when pushing changed items to Sitecore.

path.description: Child path to apply the rule to. Should be relative to the TreeSpec path.

scope.description: Sets the scope of items that are included by this rule. Items that are not part of this scope are excluded by this rule.

allowedPushOperations.description: Overrides the allowed operations for this path and descendants (other paths will follow the TreeSpec allowed operations)

alias.description:
Defines a 'path alias' that allows subtrees within the subtree to be stored higher up the filesystem.
For example if the TreeSpec path was /sitecore/foo, and a rule was created /bar/baz -> alias 'a',
then the /sitecore/foo/bar/baz/hello item would be stored on the filesystem as if its path were
/a/hello instead of its full path.
            
Used to circumvent long path length restrictions imposed by the OS.

TreeRuleScope.description: The included scope for a TreeSpecRule
